overview.title: What's Tekken 3?
content: TTekken 3 is a fighting game developed and published by Namco. It was first released in arcades in 1997 and later ported to the PlayStation in 1998.

Tekken 3 is a legendary fighting game released by Namco in 1997 for arcades and later for the PlayStation in 1998. As the third installment in the Tekken series, it introduced fluid 3D movement, new characters, and fast-paced combat mechanics. Regarded as one of the greatest fighting games of all time, Tekken 3 remains a fan favorite and a defining title of the genre.

features.title: Key Features
list: Features 23 playable characters including fan favorites like Jin Kazama and Nina Williams
Introduces the new Tekken Force beat-em-up mode
Improved graphics and gameplay mechanics over previous Tekken games

howToPlay.title: How to Play Tekken 3
howToPlay.content: The game features a deep combat system with throws, counters, and juggles. Players can execute various moves and combos using different button combinations.

history.title: Tekken 3 Game History
content: Originally released in arcades in 1997 and later ported to the PlayStation in 1998, Tekken 3 became one of the most popular and critically acclaimed fighting games, selling over 8.5 million copies on PlayStation worldwide.

Tekken 3 was first released in arcades in 1997, running on Namco's System 12 hardware. It introduced a significant graphical leap and refined gameplay compared to its predecessors. In 1998, the game was ported to the PlayStation, where it became a massive success, selling over 8 million copies. The PlayStation version included new game modes, such as Tekken Force and a new hidden character, Gon. With its impact on the fighting game genre and competitive scene, Tekken 3 is considered one of the greatest video games of all time.
